abstract: Greece is testing the waters again. The country’s debt agency said Monday that it had signed on five banks to underwrite a seven-year bond issue, just days after the major members of the euro zone and the I.M.F. agreed on a plan to support its debt.
snippet: Greece is testing the waters again. The country’s debt agency said Monday that it had signed on five banks to underwrite a seven-year bond issue, just days after the major members of the euro zone and the I.M.F. agreed on a plan to support its deb...
lead_paragraph: Greece is testing the waters again. The country’s debt agency said Monday that it had signed on five banks to underwrite a seven-year bond issue, just days after the major members of the euro zone and the International Monetary Fund agreed on a plan to support its debt.

headline.main: With Euro Zone Pledge, Greece to Issue 7-Year Bonds

abstract: Another View: Professors Jonathan Zinman and Victor Stango argue that the debate over the proposed Consumer Financial Protection Agency should be over what the agency does, not where it is located in the government’s bureaucracy.
snippet: Another View: Professors Jonathan Zinman and Victor Stango argue that the debate over the proposed Consumer Financial Protection Agency should be over what the agency does, not where it is located in the government’s bureaucracy.
lead_paragraph: Professors Jonathan Zinman and Victor Stango argue that the debate over the proposed Consumer Financial Protection Agency should be over what the agency does, not where it is located in the government’s bureaucracy.

headline.main: Another View: The Agency Consumers Really Need

abstract: Bank of America has hired four new executives in its global banking business, including three people in Asia, as part of its continued push into international banking.
snippet: Bank of America has hired four new executives in its global banking business, including three people in Asia, as part of its continued push into international banking.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America has hired four new executives in its global banking business, including three people in Asia, as part of its continued push into international banking, Reuters reports.

headline.main: Bank of America Moves to Expand in Asia

keywords.name: glocations
keywords.value: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas

abstract: The Finger family of Houston, a very dissatisfied shareholder in Bank of America, sent out a scathing letter urging shareholders to vote against the re-election of one board member and to vote for a provision to make it easier to claw back executive compensation.
snippet: The Finger family of Houston, a very dissatisfied shareholder in Bank of America, sent out a scathing letter urging shareholders to vote against the re-election of one board member and to vote for a provision to make it easier to claw back executi...
lead_paragraph: 5:44 p.m. | Updated The Finger family of Houston, a relatively large and very dissatisfied shareholder in Bank of America, sent a scathing letter to shareholders in advance of the bank’s annual meeting in late April, urging them to vote against the re-election of one board member and to vote for a provision to make it easier to claw back executive compensation.

headline.main: Finger Family Takes Aim Again at Bank of America

abstract: Baird Private Wealth Management has lured two executives from Morgan Stanley Smith Barney to join its office in Scottsdale, Ariz.
snippet: Baird Private Wealth Management has lured two executives from Morgan Stanley Smith Barney to join its office in Scottsdale, Ariz.
lead_paragraph: Baird Private Wealth Management has lured two executives from Morgan Stanley Smith Barney to join its office in Scottsdale, Ariz., Reuters reports.

headline.main: Baird Lures 2 Executives From Morgan Stanley
